conclusion: Analyze liquid flow from top containers (A, B, C, D) to bottom containers (E, F, G) using images.
First image shows four top containers (A, B, C, D) and three bottom containers (E, F, G) with angled barriers.
Liquid needs to navigate barriers to reach bottom containers.
Liquid from A (light teal) flows downward and hits the black baffle, redirecting left.
Teal liquid reaches container E based on third image.
Liquid from B (yellow) flows downward, hits yellow diagonal baffle, follows along it.
Yellow liquid encounters white horizontal baffle and redirects.
Yellow liquid reaches container F based on third image.
Liquid from C (blue) flows downward along gray baffle.
Blue liquid mixes with some white liquid and continues down.
Blue liquid reaches container G based on third image.
Liquid from D (white) flows directly downward without hitting baffles initially.
White liquid path branches, some joins with blue liquid.
Main flow of white liquid reaches container G.
Final answer: Liquid from A to E, B to F, C to G, D to G.
